Abstract: This autobiographical exploration delves into the intricate world of cannabinoid and endocannabinoid chemistry and pharmacology, offering a personal journey through the discovery and understanding of key compounds such as anandamide, 2-arachidonoylglycerol (2-AG), tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), and cannabidiol (CBD). It highlights the pivotal moments and breakthroughs in the field, from the initial identification of these molecules to their complex roles in the human body's endocannabinoid system. The narrative also touches upon the discovery and significance of endocannabinoid-like compounds, shedding light on their potential therapeutic applications. Through this personal account, the abstract aims to provide insights into the challenges and triumphs encountered in cannabinoid research, emphasizing the importance of these compounds in advancing our understanding of human physiology and pharmacology.
